name: 林子喬
objective: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the principles, methods, and applications of power system reliability assessment. It covers component reliability, system reliability indices, probabilistic methods, reliability modeling of generation, transmission, and distribution systems, as well as reliability-centered maintenance and planning.
schedule:
Wk1: Course Introduction and Rules.
Wk2~Wk3: Basic Probability and Statistics Review.
Wk4~Wk5: Component Reliability Modeling & System Reliability.
Wk6~Wk7: Reliability Indices for Generation Systems and Adequacy Evaluation Methods. 
Wk8: Reliability of Interconnected Systems.
Wk9: Midterm Close Book Exam.
Wk10~Wk11: Transmission System Reliability Evaluation.
Wk12~Wk13: Distribution System Reliability Evaluation.
Wk14: Reliability of Protection Systems
Wk15: Reliability-Centered Maintenance (RCM).
Wk16~Wk17: Reliability Economics & Integration of Renewable Energy.
Wk18: Final Close Book Exam.
scorePolicy: (一). Participation, Report, Quiz, and Homework (出席，報告，小考，與作業): 40%; (二). Midterm Exam (期中考): 30%; (三). Final Exam (期末考): 30%.
materials:
A. Textbook:
-Roy Billinton and Ronald N. Allan, Reliability Evaluation of Power Systems, Springer. 

B. Reference book:
-R.N. Allan, Power System Reliability, IEEE Press.
-Self-made materials
